results.title: The Devil at your heels
results.creator_credit: Robert Fortier, Bill Brind, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The late Ken Carter’s long-time obsession to be the world’s greatest daredevil is the subject of this feature length documentary. Seen are the five years of preparation that went into raising one million dollars, building a rocket-powered car, and constructing a ten-storey take-off ramp for his attempt to jump a car across a mile-wide stretch of the St. Lawrence River. A portrait of a stunt driver who made his living by risking his life. Photography by Barry Perles. Narrated by Gordon Pinsent. (Awards: Genie, Toronto)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Fortier, Bill Brind, Adam Symansky and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Devil and Daniel mouse
results.creator_credit: Clive A Smith, Michael Hirsh, Patrick Loubert, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Nelvana
results.brief_description: Using traditional cell animation, the timeless story of the person who sells his soul to the devil in return for present success is told. Jan and Dan are a not-too-successful folk singing duo, when Jan signs a contract with the devil to become a famous rock singer. When the devil comes to collect Jan, Dan demands a trial. Photographed by Lenora Hume; script by Ken Sobol; edited by Bob Ablack; music by John Sebastian.

results.title: The Devil's gateway
results.brief_description: Blood and the Imaginary of blood, both play a prominent part in Christian worship. The most common experience of blood - women’s menstrual bleeding - is still widely regarded as ‘unclean’. Explores the power and impact of the taboo on menstruating women still practised in society and four major religions - Orthodox Christianity, Islam, Hinduism and Orthodox Judaism. The fears women experience and the guilt and shame induced by centuries of suppression masquerading as religious laws are examined. In this program, women from all cultures describe their personal and social consequences of menstruation.

results.title: The Devil's eye = Djavulens oga
results.brief_description: The devil sends Don Juan back to earth to deflower Virtue (Bibi Andersson), the daughter of a naive country parson. She finds his advances amusing rather than irresistible. Bergman playfully contrasts the elaborately staged scenes of Hell with the reality of the pastor’s household, producing a film with a comic tone that is absent from his previous work. Cast also includes Jurl Kulle, Stig Jarrell and Gunnar Bjornstrand. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Devil's backbone = El Espinazo del diablo
results.creator_credit: Guillermo del Toro, Pedro Almodovar, Tequila Gang and El Deseo S. A.
results.brief_description: Finding himself in a home for the sons of fallen leftists in the Spanish Civil War, the naive Carlos (Fernando Tielve) discovers the desolate hideaway has more to offer than the ominous unexploded bomb in the centre of the playground. Assigned to the former bed of Santi, he soon encounters a supernatural presence shared by all but mocked with disdain by rival and bully Jaime (Inigo Garces). Meanwhile, Jacinto (Eduardo Noriega) a former resident of the orphanage poses as a janitor and becomes the lover of the headmistress Carmen (Marisa Paredes) to seek out the gold stored for the cause. As the personal history and intimate secrets of the orphanage unravel in front of Carlos’ eyes, Del Toro’s use of the war as a background serves as a political allegory on both the past and future. Cast also includes Federico Luppi, Irene Visedo.

results.title: The Devil
results.creator_credit: D.W. Griffith and American Mutoscope and Biograph Company
results.brief_description: Happily married artist is tempted by beautiful model. The Devil delights in making matters worse. Cast includes Arthur V. johnson, George Gebhardt, Harold Salter, Florence Lawrence, Mack Sennett. Silent film with no intertitles.

results.title: The Development of transportation
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Electrical Research Products and ERPI Classroom Films
results.brief_description: A study of the development of transportation in the USA during the past 150 years. The spread of railway and highway networks over the geographical barriers of the continent, and the principle stages of the development of the locomotive and automobile engines are dealt within detail; air transport, and its potentialities form the final part of this survey.

results.title: The Development of instruments and their music: a symphony is recorded
results.creator_credit: Alasdair Clayre, Open University and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: Shows the rehearsal and performance of C.P.E. Bach’s Symphony in D by the Croyland Chamber Orchestra, as it was recorded for the Open University gramophone record “The Rise of the Symphony.” Examines the steps taken to achieve a musically authoritative recording of an 18th century orchestral work.

results.title: The Development of communication
results.brief_description: Inventions are a social phenomena, although the influence of one person always tends to make them seem the result of a miraculous individual effort. This film shows the social conditions which gave rise to the invention of the battery, the ground connection, the electro-magnet, the telephone, telegraph, cable, and radio, thus making possible much more rapid and reliable communication services than had been possible in the pre-electric age. These more rapid communications were essential if industrialisation was to develop and expand.

results.title: The Detour
results.creator_credit: Shelby Leverington, Caroline Mouris and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: A film experienced entirely from the point of view of an elderly patient dying in a large hospital. As modern medicine struggles to keep eighty three year old Catherine Hamilton alive she struggles just as hard to die in peace. Each time she thinks she may be able to slip away, the doctors and nurses bring her back with a wonder drug, or a new machine. But Catherine continues to fight to control her own destiny with humour and dignity
